headline.main: Notes on People; Bishop Encouraged On Eucharist Move

results.snippet: Pointing to stacks of telegrams, and letters, San Diego's Roman Catholic Bishop, the Most Rev. Leo T. Maher, predicted yesterday that other Bishops and even Protestant church leaders would follow him in denying communion to members of the National...
results.lead_paragraph: Pointing to stacks of telegrams, and letters, San Diego's Roman Catholic Bishop, the Most Rev. Leo T. Maher, predicted yesterday that other Bishops and even Protestant church leaders would follow him in denying communion to members of the National Organization for Women "and other pro-abortion groups."

results.abstract: Former US Sen Howard M Metzenbaum of Ohio wins 2-yr tax dispute with IRS that was widely credited with contributing to his defeat in '74 Dem primary with John H Glenn; victory comes in US Tax Ct, which accepts Gov's out-of-ct decision to validate bulk of $118,000 in business tax deductions claimed in '67 and '68 by Metzenbaum on investment in Rayne, La, chem extraction plant; number of Ohio Dems believe favorable action in tax case will further encourage Metzenbaum to enter '76 race against Sen Robert A Taft Jr, Repub (M)

headline.main: TAX DISPUTE WON BY METZENBAUM; Former Ohio Senator Gains Victory in 2-Year Case

results.snippet: CLEVELAND, April 19--Former United States Senator Howard M. Metzenbaum has won a two-year-old tax dispute with the Internal Revenue Service that was widely credited with contributing to--if not sealing--his defeat in the 1974 Democratic primary by...
results.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND, April 19--Former United States Senator Howard M. Metzenbaum has won a two-year-old tax dispute with the Internal Revenue Service that was widely credited with contributing to--if not sealing--his defeat in the 1974 Democratic primary by John H. Glenn, the former astronaut who replaced him in the Sen-, ate.

results.snippet: David R. Scott, the Apollo 15 lunar-landing commander who was dropped from the astronaut corps in a controversy over unauthorized moon souvenirs, has been named director of NASA's flight research center at Edwards, Calif. Mr. Scott, 42 years old, had...
results.lead_paragraph: David R. Scott, the Apollo 15 lunar-landing commander who was dropped from the astronaut corps in a controversy over unauthorized moon souvenirs, has been named director of NASA's flight research center at Edwards, Calif. Mr. Scott, 42 years old, had been deputy director since 1973. He retired from the Air Force as a colonel in March to take the civilian appointment, ...
